title: In Springtime
description: An epic poem, written in second person narration, you get lost in the woods. For four days you try to find your place in the wild, spending your time with a mouse, a pregnant horse, and the shimmering ghost of a dead bird.

title: Clean Air
description: Publishers Weekly put it best: “The skillful blend of postapocalyptic science fiction, supernatural murder mystery, and domestic drama is unexpected and entirely engrossing.” Come for the serial killer—stay for Cami.

title: Naamah
description: A queer, radical retelling of the story of Noah’s ark, centering the story around his wife, Naamah. There’s her world on the ark, her dream world, and the surprising world she discovers under the water. Each one offers her different kinds of power and agency, but she can’t have them all.

title: Let's Not Live on Earth
description: Two books in one, Let’s Not Live on Earth begins with a collection of poems about life here on Earth, and it ends with The Starship, a book-length poem in which you get to leave this planet (finally!) for the unknown of space travel.

title: MR. WEST
description: This is an unauthorized, lyric biography of Kanye West, but only up to 2015. It covers major events in West’s life while also exploring Blake’s time spent pregnant and researching the hip-hop superstar.
